intro: Stauntonia obovata, commonly known as the broad-leaf arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, round seeds. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and floral display. Stauntonia obovata prefers moist, well-drained soil and partial to full shade in its natural habitat.
